history.content:
I took Data 100 without 8, but I didn't feel like it hindered me significantly (I had AP Stats background and ended up getting an A in the class). The only thing I can see causing problems for you would be lack of CS / coding experience. I'd taken CS 61A by that point and was concurrently taking 61B so I was used to long projects and Python syntax. Data 100 has a lab every week, homeworks, and projects, so it can be difficult to keep up if you don't learn a bit of Python and understand loops / function definition...

DS 100 has a lab in the first week (or at least last sem it did) that lets you test your prereq skills (including some multivariable calc + linear algebra), so if you struggle to complete that assignment, that might be a sign that you should take 8 / other prereqs first.

Though I understand that Data C8 is the prerequisite for C100, I am wondering how difficult it will be to take C100 without C8 aka what I will miss out from C8 that will be essential for C100 for someone who does not have 61 series but only Matlab and some stat background?
history.subject: Gap Between Data C8 and Data C100
